rename.to: Expose StubbingLookupListener publicly and create listener distinction

issue.title: Opt-in stubbing strictness implemented in JUnit rules

repository.name: mockito
repository.description: Most popular Mocking framework for unit tests written in Java

issue.body:
New API (for rationale, see #769):

```java
//Existing API:
@Rule public MockitoRule mockito = MockitoJUnit.rule()

//Proposed improvements:
rule().strictness(Strictness.LENIENT)
rule().strictness(Strictness.WARN)       // <-- is the default
rule().strictness(Strictness.STRICT_STUBS)  // <-- Mockito 3.0 default
```

What "strict stubbing" means?
- Improved debuggability: the test fails early when code under test invokes stubbed method with different arguments.
- Cleaner tests without unnecessary stubbings: the test fails when there are any unused stubs declared.
- Cleaner, more DRY tests ("Don't Repeat Yourself"): If you use Mockito.verifyNoMoreInteractions() you no longer need to explicitly verify stubbed invocations. They are automatically verified.

For background and motivation, check out [Szczepan's article on LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/curious-how-get-even-cleaner-tests-new-mockito-features-faber).

body: If exposed publicly the API should use an event object. (See https://github.com/mockito/mockito/pull/770#discussion_r91054474)

issue.title: Add StubbingLookupEvent and Notifier (a part of #793)

repository.name: mockito
repository.description: Most popular Mocking framework for unit tests written in Java

issue.body: This PR adds `StubbingLookupEvent` and `StubbingLookupNotifier` as a part of the issue #793.

issue.title: Expose StubbingLookupListener publicly (#793)

repository.name: mockito
repository.description: Most popular Mocking framework for unit tests written in Java

issue.body: This PR makes `StubbingLookupListener` public and adds `MockObjectListener` as parent of `InvocationListener` and `StubbingLookupListener`. (#793)

issue.title: Exposed new API - StubbingLookupListener

repository.name: mockito
repository.description: Most popular Mocking framework for unit tests written in Java

issue.body:
Exposed new public API based on an internal API - StubbingLookupListener - #793.

As a rule of a thumb we try to expose the internal APIs that the top level features are built upon. Since StubbingLookupListener is useful for us to implement strictness, let's get the former exposed as public API. This way we build stronger framework with the concept of "onion skin API".

This PR replaces #1466 - very nice PR from @marchpig. Due to number of changes I needed to do, I decided to reimplement the feature, rather than use the original PR. @marchpig, thank you for understanding!
